recipes.title: Slow Cooker Cinnamon Roll Monkey Bread

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are my top picks for Monkey Bread. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Spray slow cooker with non-stick spray and heat on high while you're prepping the ingredients. Combine sugar and ground cinnamon.Unroll crescent roll and sprinkle cinnamon chips over the dough. Roll dough starting with long side. Pinch edges and ends to seal. Using a serrated knife, cut dough in center, cut each of those sections in the center continueing until you have 1 inch even slices. Dip each piece of dough in butter then in sugar cinnamon mixture, place in slow cooker evenly. Try not to have them bunched up in the middle. The rolls on the bottom and sides will cook faster. After making one layer on bottom, try to stack around edge of slow cooker leaving center open.Pour any remaining butter and sugar mixture on top of rolls.Turn the slow cooker to low and cook for 2 hours. Start checking them at 1 1/2 hours, you may need to rotate some of them from the edge to the center using tongs or a fork.

steps.step: Spray slow cooker with non-stick spray and heat on high while you're prepping the ingredients.
Combine sugar and ground cinnamon.Unroll crescent roll and sprinkle cinnamon chips over the dough.

Roll dough starting with long side. Pinch edges and ends to seal. Using a serrated knife, cut dough in center, cut each of those sections in the center continueing until you have 1 inch even slices. Dip each piece of dough in butter then in sugar cinnamon mixture, place in slow cooker evenly. Try not to have them bunched up in the middle. The rolls on the bottom and sides will cook faster. After making one layer on bottom, try to stack around edge of slow cooker leaving center open.

Pour any remaining butter and sugar mixture on top of rolls.Turn the slow cooker to low and cook for 2 hours. Start checking them at 1 1/2 hours, you may need to rotate some of them from the edge to the center using tongs or a fork.
